alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Lafayette; Madison; Taylor (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 4:38PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Big Bend Florida and south central Georgia, including the following counties, in Big Bend Florida, Jefferson, Lafayette, Madison and Taylor. In south central Georgia, Brooks and Lowndes. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 437 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last 2 Hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madison, Perry, Lake Park, Valdosta, I-75 At Exit 16, Dasher, Greenville, Lee, Moseley Hall, Hopewell, Shady Grove, Lake Bird, Ebb, Sirmans, Boyd, Secotan, Iddo, Eridu, Smith and Fenholloway. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
